documentId: Understanding Arguments_ An Introduction to Informal Logic (1)
content:
ou’re sincerely seeking God, then
God will make His existence evident to you. The Bible promises, “Draw near
to God and He will draw near to you” (James 4. 8). We mustn’t so concentrate
on the proofs that we fail to hear the inner voice of God speaking to our own
heart. For those who listen, God becomes an immediate reality in their lives.
So, in conclusion, we’ve yet to see any arguments to show that God does
not exist, and we have seen five reasons to think that God does exist. And,
therefore,
